fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.fs

Interface IMediaType

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IContentType

    public interface IMediaType
    Represents MIME type definitions.

    Calling the default toString() yields a string in the format type/subtype. For text/* or application/*types, the charset encoding can be appending using variations of toString().

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be immutable and therefore completely thread-safe.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String ANY
      Represents a wildcard media type or subtype.
      static String TYPE_APPLICATION
      Represents an application media type (usually binary data).
      static String TYPE_AUDIO
      Represents an audio media type.
      static String TYPE_IMAGE
      Represents an image media type.
      static String TYPE_MULTIPART
      Represents a multipart media type.
      static String TYPE_TEXT
      Represents a text media type.
      static String TYPE_VIDEO
      Represents a video media type.

      • isAnyType

        boolean isAnyType()
        For the media type pattern type/subtype, determines if type is *.
        Returns:
        true if the media type is a wildcard type.

      • isAnySubtype

        boolean isAnySubtype()
        For the media type pattern type/subtype, determines if subtype is *.
        Returns:
        true if the media subtype is a wildcard type.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ANY

      • isText

        boolean isText()
        Determines if the media is of a text/* type.
        Returns:
        true if the type is TYPE_TEXT, without evaluating the getSubtype(). Returns false in all other cases, including wildcards.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isApplication

        boolean isApplication()
        Determines if the media is of a application/* type.
        Returns:
        true if the type is TYPE_APPLICATION, without evaluating the getSubtype(). Returns false in all other cases, including wildcards.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isImage

        boolean isImage()
        Determines if the media is of a image/* type.
        Returns:
        true if the type is TYPE_IMAGE, without evaluating the getSubtype(). Returns false in all other cases, including wildcards.
        Since:
        1.0

      • toString

        String toString(String encoding)
        For text or application media types, creates a string representation and appends the specified character set name.
        Parameters:
        encoding - the name of the character set.
        Returns:
        the HTTP content type.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified encoding is invalid.
        Since:
        1.0

      • toString

        String toString(Charset encoding)
        For text or application media types, creates a string representation and appends the specified character set name.
        Parameters:
        encoding - the name of the character set.
        Returns:
        the HTTP content type.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified encoding is null.
        Since:
        1.0
